p: To determine whether the synthesised compounds were selectively toxic towards microbes and not human cells, we evaluated the cytotoxicity of six compounds in two gastric cancer cell lines (SGC-7901 and AGS) and a normal human liver cell line (L-02) using a standard technique. As shown in Table 2, the cytotoxicities of compounds 8b, 8d, 8f and 8k were lower than that of compounds 9b and 9e. Compounds 8b, 8d, 8f and 8k had no effect on human liver cell viability at their MICs and, in addition, their IC 50 values were significantly higher than their MIC values. However, the IC 50 values of the series 9 compounds were close to their MIC values, which make it likely that the promising antibacterial activity of these compounds is due to their cytotoxic properties.
